info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 13 at 4:01PM MST until October 13 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix AZ
info.description:
At 401 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain primarily in Gilson Wash, as well as Seven Mile Wash. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Gauges reported.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Globe, San Carlos and Cutter.
Glison Wash along Old San Carlos Rd/Route 6 has experienced a 9 ft rise, as of 2258 MST, roughly 6 miles west of San Carlos. The flood wave is moving toward town.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR GILA COUNTY
